meanings.definition: The quality of being ordinary or unremarkable.
meanings.sent1: The commonplaceness of the room made it blend in with the others.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was filled with commonplaceness, lacking any memorable phrases.
meanings.sent3: The commonplaceness of the situation was almost comical in its predictability.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of stars, he was just a speck of commonplaceness.
meanings.sent5: The commonplaceness of the landscape was soothing in its familiarity.

meanings.definition: A lack of originality or uniqueness.
meanings.sent1: The artist's work was criticized for its commonplaceness, lacking any creative spark.
meanings.sent2: The commonplaceness of the design made it easily forgettable.
meanings.sent3: The movie's plot was filled with such commonplaceness that it became unintentionally funny.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were drowned in a sea of commonplaceness, unable to stand out.
meanings.sent5: The commonplaceness of his writing style made it difficult to distinguish from others.
